    Dodson_R_Package

    Tom Dodson

    12/2/2021

    Dodson_R_Package_Tutorial.Rmd

    Installation

    Load in common libraries used by this package.

    library(ggplot2)
library(tidyverse)
    ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.1 ──
    ## ✓ tibble  3.1.6     ✓ dplyr   1.0.7
## ✓ tidyr   1.1.4     ✓ stringr 1.4.0
## ✓ readr   2.0.2     ✓ forcats 0.5.1
## ✓ purrr   0.3.4
    ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
## x dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()

    Now, we install my R package:

    devtools::install_github("ThomasDodson/R_package_Dodson")
    ## Using github PAT from envvar GITHUB_PAT
    ## Downloading GitHub repo ThomasDodson/R_package_Dodson@HEAD

    Let us download some data for our package test:

    #' download.file()

    Working Example

    • An example of each function and how it works
    • Say something about why this is a good thing to do
    • Say something about expected output
    ScatterPlotDepthLength <- function(Mussel_data, Depth_Variable, Length_Variable, X_axis_label, Y_axis_label, Title){
  enquo(Depth_Variable)
  enquo(Length_Variable)
  enquo(Mussel_data)
    Plot <- ggplot(Mussel_data, mapping= aes(x=Depth_Variable, y= Length_Variable)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = "lm", color= "navy", size=0.5, fill="deeppink4") + labs(x="X_axis_label", y= "Y_axis_label", title= "Title")
    if (is.ggplot(Plot) == FALSE)
      return("Error; plot not made")
      return(Plot)
}
